```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(haven)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidycensus)
library(gt)
library(magrittr)
library(infer)
library(skimr)
library(tidyr)
library(broom)
```

```{r}
joined_salary_fine_2019 <- full_join(count_fine_2019, tabs2019, by = "fixedName")



joined_salary_fine_2019 <- joined_salary_fine_2019 %>%
  mutate(Salary = parse_number(X3, na = c("", "NA"), locale = default_locale(),
  trim_ws = TRUE))

joined_salary_fine_2019

regression_model <- lm(n ~ Salary, data = joined_salary_fine_2019) 


ggplot(joined_salary_fine_2019, aes(Salary, n)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Salary",
       y = "Number of Times Fined",
       title = "Relationship Between Salary and # of Times Fined") +
  geom_smooth(method='lm') +
  theme_classic()

ggsave("fp_ms_6_shiny/rel_graphs/scr2019.png", width = 10, height = 10)

regression_model %>%
  tidy(conf.int = TRUE) %>%
  select(term, estimate, conf.low, conf.high) %>%
  gt() %>%
  tab_header(title = "Effect of Salary on Number of Fines") %>%
  tab_spanner(label = "Data from Spotrac and Hoopshype", columns = 
                c("term", "estimate", "conf.low", "conf.high")) %>%
  cols_label(term = "Variable", estimate = "Estimate", conf.low =
               "Lower Bound", conf.high = "Upper Bound")
```
